references.paper_title: Polar factorization and monotone rearrangement of vector-valued functions
references.reason: This paper introduces the fundamental concept of polar factorization and monotone rearrangement, which is foundational to optimal transport theory and the study of Monge maps.

references.paper_title: Existence and stability results in the L1 theory of optimal transportation
references.reason: This paper establishes existence and stability results for optimal transport problems in the L1 setting, extending the theory beyond the more commonly studied L2 case.
This paper provides a geometric perspective on optimal transport, establishing connections between optimal transport maps and the geometry of underlying spaces.

references.paper_title: Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sinkhorn algorithm, a computationally efficient method for approximating optimal transport distances, enabling the application of optimal transport to larger datasets.
This paper provides a comprehensive overview of computational optimal transport, covering various algorithms, applications, and theoretical aspects of the field.
